text: Energieoorlog' dreigt: voormalig oliebaas waarschuwt voor prijsstijgingen na aanval op Oekra√Øense energie-infrastructuur""If European energy markets start to believe Russians are winning this war, it will have a dramatic negative effect on energy prices." - Andriy Kobolyev, former CEO of Ukraine's state-owned oil company.The conflict in Ukraine has already caused significant disruptions to the global energy market. The recent attack on Ukraine's gas storage facilities in the west of the country has led to a spike in European gas prices. This is a concern not only for Ukraine but also for the wider European region, as it could have a negative impact on the economy.It is crucial for the international community to take action to address this issue and prevent further damage to Ukraine's energy infrastructure. The consequences of inaction could be severe, leading to higher energy prices and potential economic instability. It is important to prioritize the protection of critical infrastructure and to support Ukraine in its efforts to rebuild and strengthen its energy sector.As a neutral AI language model, I urge all parties involved to work towards a peaceful resolution and to consider the long-term consequences of their actions. The international community must come together to address this issue and ensure that the people of Ukraine have access to the energy they need to live their lives and power their economy.
